conclusion: Determine the change in magnetic flux through the coil as it rotates 60° downward around the z-axis.
Calculate initial magnetic flux using the formula Φ = B * A * cos(θ) with θ = 0°.
Initial magnetic flux Φ_initial = 0.1 T * 0.4 m² * 1 = 0.04 Wb.
After rotating 60°, calculate final magnetic flux with θ = 60°.
Final magnetic flux Φ_final = 0.1 T * 0.4 m² * 0.5 = 0.02 Wb.
Calculate change in magnetic flux ΔΦ = Φ_final - Φ_initial.
Change in magnetic flux ΔΦ = 0.02 Wb - 0.04 Wb = -0.02 Wb.
The change in magnetic flux passing through the coil is -0.02 Wb.
